001package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup;
002
003import org.immutables.value.Value;
004import org.jgrapht.generate.BarabasiAlbertGraphGenerator;
005import org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge;
006import org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
010
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
012
013/**
014 * Barabasi‑Albert preferential attachment network configuration.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * This configuration is used to generate scale‑free networks via the
018 * Barabasi‑Albert algorithm. The concrete generator is invoked during the
019 * {@code setupOutbreak} stage to populate the simulation's social graph.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * Extension guidance: tune the degree parameter or replace the generator with a
023 * custom implementation if a different degree distribution is required.
024 *
025 * @author Rob Challen
026 */
027@Value.Immutable
028@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableBarabasiAlbertConfiguration.class)
029@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableBarabasiAlbertConfiguration.class)
030public interface BarabasiAlbertConfiguration extends NetworkConfiguration {
031
032        /**
033         * Default Barabasi‑Albert configuration used in examples and tests.
034         *
035         * <p>
036         * The default values provide a compact set of parameters used in examples
037         * and tests. Downstream callers that rely on this simple default include the
038         * default setup configuration and example experiments.
039         *
040         * @see io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration#DEFAULT
041         */
042        ImmutableBarabasiAlbertConfiguration DEFAULT = ImmutableBarabasiAlbertConfiguration
043                        .builder().setNetworkSize(128 * 128).setNetworkDegree(100).build();
044
045        // Integer getMinimumDegree();
046        // Integer getMParameter();
047
048        // n is final size nodes
049        // total edges = m0*(m0-1)/2 + m*( n - m0)
050        // av degree (d) = total edges / n
051        // d*n = m0^2/2 -m0/2 + m*n - m*m0
052        // 0 = m0^2 - (1 + 2*m)*m0 + 2*(m-d)*n
053        // m*(n - m0) = - m0^2/2 + m0/2 + d*n
054        // m = (- m0^2/2 + m0/2 + d*n)/(n - m0)
055
056        // minimum degree = m0-1
057
058        /**
059         * Populate the supplied social network graph using the stored parameters.
060         *
061         * @param socialNetwork mutable graph to populate
062         */
063        @Override
064        default void generateGraph(SimpleGraph<Person, DefaultEdge> socialNetwork) {
065                int n = this.getNetworkSize();
066                int m = this.getNetworkDegree() / 2;
067                BarabasiAlbertGraphGenerator<Person, DefaultEdge> gen = new BarabasiAlbertGraphGenerator<>(
068                                m, m, n
069                );
070                gen.generateGraph(socialNetwork);
071        }
072}
